content:
=== Game Rules ===
This is vgdl rule file:
BasicGame square_size=32
    SpriteSet
        background > Immovable img=oryx/space1 hidden=True
        base    > Immovable    color=WHITE img=oryx/planet
        avatar  > FlakAvatar   stype=sam img=oryx/spaceship1
        missile > Missile
            sam  > orientation=UP    color=BLUE singleton=True img=oryx/bullet1
            bomb > orientation=DOWN  color=RED  speed=0.5 img=oryx/bullet2
        alien   > Bomber       stype=bomb   prob=0.01  cooldown=3 speed=0.8
            alienGreen > img=oryx/alien3
            alienBlue > img=oryx/alien1
        portal  > invisible=True hidden=True
        	portalSlow  > SpawnPoint   stype=alienBlue  cooldown=16   total=20 img=portal
        	portalFast  > SpawnPoint   stype=alienGreen  cooldown=12   total=20 img=portal

    LevelMapping
        . > background
        0 > background base
        1 > background portalSlow
        2 > background portalFast
        A > background avatar

    TerminationSet
        SpriteCounter      stype=avatar               limit=0 win=False
        MultiSpriteCounter stype1=portal stype2=alien limit=0 win=True

    InteractionSet
        avatar  EOS  > stepBack
        alien   EOS  > turnAround
        missile EOS  > killSprite

        base bomb > killBoth
        base sam > killBoth scoreChange=1

        base   alien > killSprite
        avatar alien > killSprite scoreChange=-1
        avatar bomb  > killSprite scoreChange=-1
        alien  sam   > killSprite scoreChange=2

This is vgdl rule in natural language:
This game is a space shooter in the vein of classic titles like Space Invaders or Galaga. Here’s a breakdown of its key elements and a possible strategy:

• Genre and Mechanics
 – You control an avatar (a spaceship) that can fire an upward-moving projectile (called “sam”). The ship’s movement is limited–if it reaches the edge of the screen (EOS), it “steps back” so you don’t go off‐screen.
 – Alien enemies are spawned by two types of portals (one spawning “alienBlue” slowly and another “alienGreen” a bit faster). The aliens move around, and when they reach the screen boundaries they turn around; they can also drop bombs (bomb sprites) that travel downward.
 – There is also a stationary “base” (a planet sprite) on the field, which appears to be a key element in some interactions.

• Objective and Win/Loss Conditions
 – Your main objective is to eliminate the enemy aliens and the portals that spawn them. The win condition is met when there are no more aliens and no more portals active on the screen.
 – The game is lost when your avatar is destroyed (i.e. when its counter reaches zero).

• Score Interactions
 – When your projectile (sam) hits an alien, it destroys the alien and you gain score (+2).
 – If you accidentally hit the base with your projectile, it kills both and gives you a smaller score bonus (+1). (This suggests some careful aiming is needed in case your base is nearby.)
 – Colliding with aliens or enemy bombs is penalized (–1 score) and is dangerous for your avatar.

• Overall Strategy
 1. Stay Mobile and Avoid Damage: Keep maneuvering to dodge enemy aliens and their slow-moving bombs. Since collisions with aliens or bombs reduce your score and risk losing your ship, careful evasion is key.
 2. Prioritize Targets: Focus on shooting down aliens with your upward “sam” shots to rack up points (+2 per hit). Eliminating them quickly will help prevent their return fire (bombs) from endangering you.
 3. Shut Down the Spawn Points: The portals are critical because they keep bringing enemies into the game. Once you have a chance, target the portals to stop more aliens from appearing. Clearing these spawn points leads directly toward meeting the win condition.
 4. Protect Your Base: Although your base is a stationary object, note that certain interactions (like a bomb hitting your base) can remove it. Keeping your base intact, if it plays any secondary role in your defense or scoring, might be important.
 5. Balance Offense and Defense: While you’re busy shooting aliens, keep an eye on enemy movements and bombs—it’s all about finding the right balance between attacking and dodging.

In summary, you’re piloting a spaceship in a classic shooter setup. Your job is to dodge enemy fire and collisions, quickly take out alien invaders with your projectiles, and shut down the portals to prevent new enemies from appearing. By staying agile, prioritizing high-value targets, and managing both offense and defense, you maximize your score and secure victory.

You are an intelligent player playing a video game, and you have a friend provide you strategy. Interpret the state, rule, strategy and act accordingly. Notice that your avatar position is one of the most important information, if the position doesn't change from the last state, you need to analyze the state and make a different action from the last time.

=== Available Actions ===
0: ACTION_NIL
1: ACTION_USE
2: ACTION_LEFT
3: ACTION_RIGHT

=== Important Mechanics Notice ===
 In some games, directional actions (LEFT, RIGHT, UP, DOWN) may first cause the avatar to rotate toward the intended direction without immediately moving. If the avatar's position does not change after a directional action, it may indicate a rotation has occurred. To proceed, you must apply the directional action again after rotation. Always verify whether the avatar actually moved after each action. Please understand the rule and the interaction set first, then locate the item, finally choose a meaningful action towards the win and respond in the format: ``` Action:<action number> ```. Include one sentence of feedback on the action and your expectation to see if it aligns with the strategy. Notice, Action 0 will not reasult in any change in this game environment, and you may need to understand the level layout first to play the game.

Action:2

I'm moving left so that my spaceship may line up with the alien at column 0 above; this repositioning should set me up to fire a sam shot upward on a high-value target.

=== Sprite Mapping ===

background portalSlow -> '1'
background portalFast -> '2'
alienGreen -> '@'
base -> '#'
sam -> '$'
